result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Serve 5 days in the Pepin County Jail with good time as follows:
2 days commencing 7/15/16 at 6:00 pm.
2 days commencing 7/22/16 at 6:00 pm.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties. Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea Colloquy. Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  State confirms VR complied with, no VIS; recommends 40 hrs. community service in lieu of 5 days jail.  Atty Smith requests C/S.  Court declines C/S sentenced defendant to 5 days in the PCJ w/good time; 7/15 @ 6 pm to 2 days, then 7/22 @ 6 pm serve 2 days.  Court waives costs.  Advised of appeal rights.

Attorney Gary E. Smith in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant f/t/a.  Atty Smith unsure why his client is not here as they were ready to resolved the matter today.  He does inform the court his client is on probation.  New date set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel requests to come back on 6/21/16.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Melissa Ann Lemire-Steilling in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advised of charge/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $500 Sign. Bond, defendant has extensive criminal history.  Court sets $500 Sign. Bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
